item.title: Stablecoin Design with Adversarial-Robust Multi-Agent Systems via Trust-Weighted Signal Aggregation
item.description:
Summary

  • Introduces MVF-Composer, a trust-weighted Mean-Variance Frontier reserve controller for algorithmic stablecoins that incorporates a Stress Harness using multi-agent simulations to adversarially stress-test reserve policies.
  • Defines a trust-scoring mechanism T: A -> [0,1] that down-weights signals from agents exhibiting manipulative behavior to mitigate signal injection and Sybil attacks in risk-state estimation.
  • Evaluates across 1,200 randomized crisis scenarios (including coordinated redemption attacks and large collateral/sentiment shocks), reporting a 57% reduction in peak peg deviation, 3.1x faster mean recovery, and 72% adversarial agent detection; ablation shows the trust layer contributes ~23% of stability gains.
  • Implementation runs on commodity hardware, requires only standard on-chain price feeds (no extra oracles), and provides a reproducible framework for stress-testing DeFi reserve controllers.

Paper Type

  • Research

Additional Information

  • Authors: ['Shengwei You', 'Aditya Joshi', 'Andrey Kuehlkamp', 'Jarek Nabrzyski']
  • Tags: ['stablecoins', 'DeFi', 'adversarial-robustness', 'multi-agent simulation', 'Sybil/attack detection']
